duties_responsibilities.duty: Leverage industry and product knowledge to drive key accounts and encourage, support, and develop field sales resources.
Develop high, wide, and deep relationships with the largest and most complex customers and key stakeholders to increase revenue and drive brand loyalty.
Pursue relationships with potential new key accounts and seek business expansion opportunities with current customers.
Provide direction and guidance for key accounts, meet or exceed annual sales targets or quotas, and suggest product improvements or expanding sales channels.
Visit customer locations and work sites periodically to ensure customer satisfaction, promote ongoing business, and expand reach within commercial and residential build projects.
Collaborate with sales leadership to identify key opportunities for revenue growth and product targets within assigned region for inclusion in annual sales compensation planning.
Analyze customer's technical specifications, recommend the best product configuration and installation process, and estimate implementation effort, time, and resources.

Use technical knowledge of product offerings to advise and support sales teams with pricing estimates, sales quotations, requests for proposals, and implementation guidance based on customer requirements.
Work with the Learning department to implement sales training and onboarding programs to prepare salespeople to discuss products and engage with potential customers or opportunities.
Design and deliver training sessions on company products, business practices, industry context, competitive information, and other topics as needed.
Coach field sales representatives on product categories technical value, proper execution of strategies, value proposition, and general best practices.
Participate in progress evaluations for field sales representatives tasked with driving the specialized scope.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, building construction, sales/marketing, or other related field preferred; or experience in lieu of degree. Minimum High School Diploma or GED with 7 years of construction or industry experience.
